article:
Four ships of the Royal Navy have borne the name 'HMSPilot':

* was a 14-gun brig-sloop, formerly the French Mutin-class cutter Pilote.
  Pilote was launched November 1778 at Dunkirk. Demerliac (1996), p.87,
  #573. She was under the command of the Chevalier de Clonard when
  captured her on 2 October 1779, together with ''Mutine''; the
  Admiralty sold her in May 1799.
* was an 18-gun ''Cruizer''-class brig-sloop launched in 1807 and sold in 1828.
* was a 16-gun brig-sloop launched in 1838 and sold in 1862.
* was an 8-gun training brig launched in 1879 and sold in 1907.
